settingsPane.description: Here you can choose whether to apply STweaks settings on BOOT or not.
settingsPane.name: Global BOOT Settings

spinner.description: Master Switch - load ALL settings from ALL tabs on BOOT or not! Default is LOAD.
spinner.name: Enable On Boot

spinnerItem.name: Don't load all Settings on boot

button.description: Push this in order to load all tuned settings IF the master switch is (or was already) OFF. If the master switch was ON when phone booted, then you don't need to touch this, wait until STweaks will close then start STweaks again if you wish.
button.name: LOAD ALL
button.label: LOAD ALL

settingsPane.name: CPU Power Save
settingsPane.description: Energy-Saving Mode for Multi-CORE Processors

seekBar.description: Sets the sched_mc value which changes the cpu scheduler behaviour for multi-cpu systems. 0 is kernel's default value which turns sched_mc off. Setting it to 1 means that the first core will be tried to be loaded more and setting it to 2 will bias task wake-ups to semi-idle cpu package for power savings. (default: 0)
seekBar.name: sched_mc

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the CPU Active Governor per core
settingsPane.name: CPU Active Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU0 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU0 Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU1 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU1 Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU2 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU2 Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU3 governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU3 Governor

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the Maximum CPU Frequency per core, when set here no other APP or Service can set higher!!!
settingsPane.name: Maximum CPU Frequency

checkbox.description: Enable or disable CPU-Tweaks below! If ON, then kernel will obey only STweaks and set the frequencies selected below, on screen OFF and ON
checkbox.name: CPU-Tweaks
checkbox.label: CPU-Tweaks

spinner.description: Maximum CPU0 Speed. Here, you can change the maximum CPU0 frequency allowed. This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 1 890 000 Khz)
spinner.name: Max CPU0 Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU1 Speed. Here, you can change the maximum CPU1 frequency allowed. This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 1 890 000 Khz)
spinner.name: Max CPU1 Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU2 Speed. Here, you can change the maximum CPU2 frequency allowed. This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 1 890 000 Khz)
spinner.name: Max CPU2 Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU3 Speed. Here, you can change the maximum CPU3 frequency allowed. This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 1 890 000 Khz)
spinner.name: Max CPU3 Frequency

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune the Minimum CPU Frequency per core
settingsPane.name: Minimum CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU0 Speed. Here, you can change the minimum CPU0 frequency allowed (it can't be higher than Maximum CPU0 Speed). This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 384 000 Khz)
spinner.name: Min CPU0 Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU1 Speed. Here, you can change the minimum CPU1 frequency allowed (it can't be higher than Maximum CPU1 Speed). This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 384 000 Khz)
spinner.name: Min CPU1 Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU2 Speed. Here, you can change the minimum CPU2 frequency allowed (it can't be higher than Maximum CPU2 Speed). This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 384 000 Khz)
spinner.name: Min CPU2 Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU3 Speed. Here, you can change the minimum CPU3 frequency allowed (it can't be higher than Maximum CPU3 Speed). This depends on CPU-Tweaks (has to be enabled above)! (Default is 384 000 Khz)
spinner.name: Min CPU3 Frequency

settingsPane.description: Here you can select the GPU Governor, set Min and Max GPU frequency and update tuning.
settingsPane.name: GPU Governors and settings

spinner.description: Select GPU Governor that will control GPU frequency according to GPU load and system needs - if you select Performance Governor, then the GPU will be at MAX frequency nonstop!
spinner.name: GPU Active Governor

spinner.description: Select GPU Max frequency when needed! GPU will stay at MIN frequency on IDLE.
spinner.name: GPU Max Speed

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune Simple Governor! Use the controls ONLY if Simple is selected (otherwise nothing will happen).
settingsPane.name: Simple Governor Controls

spinner.description: Set Laziness Value of Simple GPU Governors. (Default is 5) reduce it = better performance -> more battery drain
spinner.name: Simple Laziness

spinner.description: Set Ramp Theshold Value. (Default is 6000) increase it = better performance -> more battery drain
spinner.name: Simple Ramp Threshold

settingsPane.description: RGB colors Control. Please turn the SCREEN OFF and ON for the settings to be applied !
settingsPane.name: Gamma Control

seekBar.description: Red tint control
seekBar.name: Red tint. (Default: 60)

seekBar.description: Green tint control
seekBar.name: Green tint. (Default: 60)

seekBar.description: Blue tint control
seekBar.name: Blue tint. (Default: 60)

settingsPane.description: The notification LED has two brightness modes, depending on the external brightness detected by the light sensor.
settingsPane.name: Brightness

seekBar.description: LED brightness in low brightness environments.
seekBar.name: Low light environment brightness

seekBar.description: LED brightness in high brightness environments.
seekBar.name: Bright light environment brightness

settingsPane.description: Control the way the LED blinks. The LED controller has 4 type of slopes in its waveform, 2 rising slopes, and two falling slopes. The following configurables can control the blinking waveform.
settingsPane.name: Blinking effect

seekBar.description: Sets the time period of the two rising slopes (1,2), one time-unit is equal to 0.5 seconds.
seekBar.name: Fade-in time period

seekBar.description: Sets the time period of the two falling slopes (3,4), one time-unit is equal to 0.5 seconds.
seekBar.name: Fade-out time period

checkbox.description: If disabled, ignores the below detention times and the blinking waveform has no slopes, i.e. it is square.
checkbox.name: Enable fading
checkbox.label: Enable LED fading

seekBar.description: The LED is controlled by PWM/pulse wave modulation, the detention time dictates how long the controller spends time on a single step in its slope. One time-unit is equivalent to 4ms.
seekBar.name: Slope 1 detention time

settingsPane.name: AC/USB Charge control
settingsPane.description: AC/USB Charge control

spinner.description: Charge control switch
spinner.name: Charge control switch

spinner.description: Use MTP during fast charge
spinner.name: Use MTP during fast charge

spinner.description: Current limit with the screen ON
spinner.name: Current limit with the screen ON

spinner.description: USB charge current (default 460 mA)
spinner.name: USB Charge

spinner.description: AC charge current (default 1000 mA)
spinner.name: AC Charge

settingsPane.name: I/O settings
settingsPane.description: I/O settings

spinner.description: This will set the default I/O scheduler for Internal and External Storage. Default: cfq
spinner.name: Default I/O Scheduler for Internal Storage

seekBar.description: The read-ahead value for the internal storage. Default: 128
seekBar.name: Internal storage read-ahead

seekBar.description: The read-ahead value for the external storage (SD-Card). Default: 256
seekBar.name: SD card read-ahead

button.description: Use this button to Trim System and Data Nand partitions to speed up Read and Write Access, good to use once in a day or two.
button.name: Trim System and Data
button.label: Trim NOW

settingsPane.name: Sound Control
settingsPane.description: Tune Mic, Headphones and Speaker volume gain

seekBar.description: Control for Camera recording MIC gain volume
seekBar.name: Camera MIC gain

seekBar.description: Control for MIC gain volume
seekBar.name: MIC gain

seekBar.description: Control for Headphones gain volume
seekBar.name: Headphones Gain

seekBar.description: Control for Headphones Power Amp gain volume
seekBar.name: Headphones Power Amp Gain

seekBar.description: Control for Handset MIC gain volume on call
seekBar.name: Handset MIC gain on call

seekBar.description: Control for HDMI Speaker gain volume
seekBar.name: HDMI Speaker Gain

seekBar.description: Control for Speaker gain volume
seekBar.name: Speaker Gain

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune memory and OOM (low memory management) settings managed by the kernel.
settingsPane.name: Memory Tuning

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable zRam (needs reboot). Default: on
checkbox.name: zRam
checkbox.label: zRam

seekBar.description: zRam disk size (needs reboot). Default: 700 MB
seekBar.name: zRam disk size

checkbox.description: Enable AUTO OOM control using the profiles below; disable if you want to set your own OOM tuning via another app or script.
checkbox.name: Auto OOM
checkbox.label: Auto OOM Control

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low memory management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen ON

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low memory management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen OFF

seekBar.description: Swappiness. Default: 60%
seekBar.name: Swappiness

seekBar.description: Dirty background memory buffer. The more you set, the more memory will be used for write buffer for background operations. Buffer is released when it is needed to free RAM
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

seekBar.description: Dirty real time memory buffer. The more you set, the more memory will be used for write buffer for real time operations. Buffer is released when it is needed to free RAM
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

settingsPane.name: Android Logger
settingsPane.description: Android Logger

checkbox.description: It is recommended to disable Android Logger if you do not need it. Default: On
checkbox.name: Enable/Disable Android Logger
checkbox.label: Enable Android logger

settingsPane.name: SELinux
settingsPane.description: SELinux Control

spinner.description: Allows you to change your SELinux (Security-Enhanced Linux) Status from Enforcing (policy is enforced) to Permissive (prints warnings instead of enforcing).
spinner.name: SeLinux Control

settingsPane.name: TCP congestion control
settingsPane.description: TCP congestion control

spinner.description: TCP congestion control method. Default: cubic
spinner.name: TCP congestion control method

settingsPane.description: You can check what profile is in use right now.
settingsPane.name: Online Profile

button.description: This displays your currently used profile.
button.name: Profile Check
button.label: Profile Check

settingsPane.description: Here you can choose kernel profiles.
settingsPane.name: STweaks Profiles

settingsPane.description: Here you can backup or restore your profile after installing new kernel. Some settings will work only after reboot! Restore will take up to 30 sec, just wait!
settingsPane.name: STweaks Settings Backup or Restore
